intro: Urostachya cepifolia, commonly known as the mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
